chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm)
Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Franklin Atkins Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Franklin Atkins Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Franklin Atkins Miller was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(a).
  • Franklin Atkins Miller was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Franklin Atkins Miller was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court
Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court
Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. The total length of sentence for Ct. 1 is 3 years 6 mos.
The initial term of confinement in prison is 1 year 6 mos.
The time served on Extended Supervision is 2 years.
The Def is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
The Def is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
ES Cond's:  To seek, obtain & maintain full time employment.  Def to pay support as due & comply w/order of Ct re: pymt of arrears.    Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!    The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.    Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.  Def to have NO contact w/L.A.M. until she is ready & approved by counselor & Mother.    The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.  AODA & follow thru.
This sentence is imposed/stayed and placed on probation.
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland 12/14/15.
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Added to current pymt plan.
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Def to pay support as due & comply w/order of Ct re: pymt of arrears.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
Def to have NO contact w/L.A.M. until she is ready & approved by counselor & Mother.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
